com.innowhere.jnieasy.core.data
Interface NativeCharacterObject

All Superinterfaces:
CanBeNativeCapable, NativeCapable, NativeFieldContainer, NativeObjectFieldContainer, NativePrimitiveObject, NativeSingleFieldContainer
public interface NativeCharacterObject
extends NativePrimitiveObject

The NativeCharacterObject is the interface implemented by native capable classes working as wrappers of java.lang.Character objects.

The framework has an internal class implementing this interface. An instance contains (or must contain) a java.lang.Character object.

If native the corresponding native memory is a char (jchar), a Java reference of this type can be considered like a jchar* native variable.

Author:
Jose M. Arranz Santamaria

Method Summary
 java.lang.Character getCharacter()
          Returns the internal Character object synchronized with the native memory if instance is native.

Method Detail

getCharacter

java.lang.Character getCharacter()
Returns the internal Character object synchronized with the native memory if instance is native.

If internal Character object is null or native memory value is different to the character value hold by this instance, a new Character object is created, saved and returned, otherwise the current object is returned.

Current implementation is:

return (Character)getValue();

Returns:
the internal Character object. Never is null.
See Also:
NativeSingleFieldContainer.getValue()

setCharacter

void setCharacter(java.lang.Character value)
Sets the internal Character object synchronizing the native memory with the new value if instance is native.

If native the native memory is updated with the character value hold by the new Character value.

Current implementation is:

setValue(value);

Parameters:
value - the new value. Can not be null.
See Also:
NativeSingleFieldContainer.setValue(Object)
